metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8105 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - negligible
metadata.Description:
The JPXStream::fillReadBuf function in JPXStream.cc in xpdf 4.00 allowsattackers to launch denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read andapplication crash) via a specific pdf file, as demonstrated by pdftohtml.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8105` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler73 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
poppler package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.62.0-1ubuntu1').
ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
